result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan M Palmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Columbia County Court Conviction DNA - DNA taken
Filed by Attorney Tristan Eagon
Filed by Attorney Tristan Eagon
Restitution Stipulation in the probation amount of $44.67 plus surcharge for a total of $49.13

Defendant Ryan M Palmer in court with attorney Tristan F Eagon.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court sentenced defendant to pay restitution plus surcharge (paid prior to court).  $705.00 fines/costs.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  Submit DNA sample.  3 days credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 24, 2017 at 02:45 pm.
Defendant Ryan M Palmer in court with attorney Tristan F Eagon.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant quashed.  Sentencing has been set by JA.

Attorney Tristan F Eagon appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Eagon not sure why defendant did not appear.  State requested a warrant.  Warrant authorized, stayed until 1-10-17 end of day.

Defendant Ryan M Palmer in court with attorney Tristan F Eagon.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Eagon requested a plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 5, 2017 at 02:45 pm.

from Atty Genda to Columbia County Sheriff's Office re: cancellation of warrant

Defendant, Ryan M Palmer, appeared by video from Columbia County Jail with Attorney Jennifer Cunha, special for Atty. Eagon. Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement regarding missed court appearance. ADA Burdon requested $300 cash bond with prior conds. Bond argument by Atty. Cunha. Court ordered $150 cash bond w/not go premises of Portage Walmart.  Warrant quashed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 02:10 pm.  Return date scheduled for October 12, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
